kiwis is good idea to search for information offline
Quite often I'm not sure what is the difference between different dicts. With or without images, simple or standard English, they all look the same on the table!
summary: Works, but what am I downloading?

description: I wanted to install it on my desktop, it simply is not installing.
Like many people I have a tiny but fast boot drive and a slow and large drive for data in my computer. Unfortunately Kiwix will only see the boot drive so I cannot use this app
summary: Will only use my tiny boot drive

description: Freezes when downloading on F32 through flatpak.

On start Kiwix should connect to aria2c, but, unfortunately it's not preinstalled by installing Kiwix automatically and additionally way to where aria2 is installed is wrong(/app/bin/aria2c instead of usr/bin/aria2c). Might need fix for Clear Linux working with Kiwix.
summary: Clear Linux path is probably wrong

description:
just works, and supplies everything- content, local files, local wiki hosting on network. yea- no hops over the backbone on the internet has never been so easy to just give to any normie with a web-browser on the same Wi-Fi.

just sad to see it uses a legacy windowing system still, but hey.

Sorry to have to give this 1 star, but this app just isn't doing anything! It appears to install fine and it seems to open fine, no error messages. When I type in something to serch the online Wikipedia, nothing happens! Very dissappointing. Please fix. I'm running Ubuntu 22.04, KDE Plasma 5.24.7.

NO DARK MODE !

ABANDONED? (1) DELETES some ZIM (wiki) files after use! FIX THIS AMATEUR BUG! (

2) Download stops at 99%, sometimes popup error_mssg aria2c... download fail, but it actually has worked & downloaded, just close downloaad & relaunch app. Downloads to folder you set, see below. 

(3)Most Linux users are coders or techies & mostly work with dark mode apps for long hours. This app is a BLINDING white only. Not modern at all. PLEASE make a DARK MODE option, make it real dark, not just grey. It is a good start, their android app was terrible but after years got updated with fixes & is OK(ish) now. 

TIPS): in SETTINGS: Change default folder to /Documents/Kiwix, performs same.
+
Also set MONITOR_DIRECTORY in settings to same folder. 
Then start "LOCAL_WIKI_SERVER" from ... 3 dots menu at top or CTRL+i.
Then can use in borowser (Firefox etc with DARK_READER extension) in dark mode.
+
JUST LET SOMEONE UPDATE THIS LINUX VERSION & NOT KEEP ABANDONWARE as you did for years with android version? FIRST: DARK MODE. Thanks.

Какую бы место для хранения я не выбирал, какой бы файл не пытался скачать - всегда одна и та же ошибка. 
Ну вот было же старое-доброе приложение, которое нормально работало, нет - придумали это, которое вообще никак не работает.
